info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:57PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN MIDLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN MARTIN COUNTIES... At 556 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles south of Greenwood, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Midland, Greenwood, Cotton Flat and Midland Airpark. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 132 and 149. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
